com.appscend.media

Class APSMediaOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.appscend.media.APSMediaTrackableObject
      • com.appscend.media.APSMediaOverlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class APSMediaOverlay
extends APSMediaTrackableObject
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    APSMediaOverlay describes any overlay that the APSMediaPlayer instance needs to render during playback.
    Author:
    Appscend

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  APSMediaOverlay.APSMediaOverlayPosition
      Describes the position the overlay should take when placed on-screen by the player.

    • Field Detail

      • absoluteOffsetX

        public java.lang.String absoluteOffsetX
        The overlay's absolute horizontal offset in pixels, relative to the current origin. The current origin is determined by the overlay's position parameter, while the positive direction is always toward the center of the player surface.

      • absoluteOffsetY

        public java.lang.String absoluteOffsetY
        The overlay's absolute vertical offset in pixels, relative to the current origin. The current origin is determined by the overlay's position parameter, while the positive direction is always toward the center of the player surface.

      • controller

        public java.lang.Object controller
        A refence to the overlay controller object. This is set by the player, on the overlay's initial render.

      • fadeInDuration

        public float fadeInDuration
        The duration (in seconds) for the fade in effect of the overlay, when it is placed on and taken off screen.

      • height

        public java.lang.String height
        The height of the overlay. Supports pixels (e.g.: @“320”) or percentages, relative to the total height (e.g.: @“50%”).

      • parameters

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters
        Overlay parameters. Implementation-specific to overlay controllers.

      • parentUnit

        public APSMediaUnit parentUnit

        After being added to a APSMediaUnit object, a reference to this parent can be found here.

      • position

        public APSMediaOverlay.APSMediaOverlayPosition position

        Describes the position the overlay should take when placed on-screen by the player. APSMediaOverlayPosition for available values.

      • repeatAfter

        public float repeatAfter
        If this parameter is greater than 0, then the overlay will be reshown by the media player after the specific time interval (in seconds).

      • shouldBeRemoved

        public boolean shouldBeRemoved

      • type

        public java.lang.String type

      • width

        public java.lang.String width
        The width of the overlay. Supports pixels (e.g.: @“320”) or percentages, relative to the total width (e.g.: @“50%”).

      • zIndex

        public int zIndex
        The order of the overlay in the current view stack.

    • Constructor Detail

      • APSMediaOverlay

        public APSMediaOverlay()

    • Method Detail

      • adjustRelativeToDuration

        public void adjustRelativeToDuration(int duration)
        Translates percentual values set via setStartPoint to actual time intervals in seconds, relative to a specified total duration.
        Parameters:
        duration - The total duration.

      • copyWithZone

        public APSMediaOverlay copyWithZone()

      • endPoint

        public int endPoint()
        The time interval (in seconds) when the player needs to remove the overlay.
        Warning: If percentual values were set via setStartPoint, this value will change immediately after the current clip's duration is available.
        Returns:
        The final time interval.

      • incrementStartAndEndPointsWithInterval

        public void incrementStartAndEndPointsWithInterval(float duration)
        Shifts air-time for an overlay by a defined amount of time.
        Parameters:
        duration - Shift duration in seconds.

      • setEndPoint

        public void setEndPoint(java.lang.String endPoint)
        Sets the ending time point of the overlay.
        Parameters:
        endPoint - A string format describing the time point when the player needs to remove the overlay. Possible values are seconds (e.g.: @“60”) or a percentage relative to the total duration of the parent clip (e.g.: @“50%”).

      • setStartPoint

        public void setStartPoint(java.lang.String startPoint)
        Sets the starting time point of the overlay.
        Parameters:
        startPoint - A string format describing the time point when the player needs to display the overlay. Possible values are seconds (e.g.: @“60”) or a percentage relative to the total duration of the parent clip (e.g.: @“50%”).

      • startPoint

        public int startPoint()
        The time interval (in seconds) when the player needs to display the overlay.
        Warning: If percentual values were set via setStartPoint, this value will change immediately after the current clip's duration is available.
        Returns:
        The initial time interval.
